recommend.title: Player Data Recommended
recommend.description: This page is better with player data.
recommend.tap_here: Tap here to import your player data now.

require.title: Player Data Required
require.description: This page requires player data. Follow the instructions below to import your player data.

copy_and_paste.title: Copy and Paste
copy_and_paste.description_2: then paste everything into the text box below.

detailed_instructions.title: Detailed Instructions...
detailed_instructions.header: DataCore cannot make direct requests to the game's servers, so you must follow these steps to import your {{data}}:

instructions.line_1: Open this page in your browser: {{link}}
instructions.line_2: Sign in if asked, then wait for the page to finish loading. It should start with: {{jsonHint}} ...
instructions.line_3: Select everything in the page (Ctrl+A) and copy to clipboard (Ctrl+C).
instructions.line_4: Paste (Ctrl+V) in the text box above. Note that DataCore will intentionally display less data here to speed up the process.

detailed_instructions.footer: If you have multiple accounts, we recommend using your browser in incognito mode (Chrome) or in private mode (Edge / Firefox) to avoid caching your account credentials, making it easier to switch accounts.

upload_file.title: Upload File
upload_file.description_2: then upload the file. Recommended for mobile users.

detailed_instructions.title: Detailed Instructions...
detailed_instructions.header: DataCore cannot make direct requests to the game's servers, so you must follow these steps to import your {{data}}:

instructions.line_1: Open this page on your device: {{link}}
instructions.line_2: Sign in if asked, then wait for the page to finish loading. It should start with: {{jsonHint}} ...
instructions.line_3: Tap the menu (three dots) icon while viewing the page.
instructions.line_4: Tap the download button, choose a location, and save.
instructions.line_5: Come back to this DataCore page.
instructions.line_6: Tap the "Browse for {{data}} file to upload..." button.
instructions.line_7: Choose the file starting with "{{hint}}..." from where you saved it.

instructions.line_1: Open this page on your device: {{link}}
instructions.line_2: Sign in if asked, then wait for the page to finish loading. It should start with: {{jsonHint}} ...
instructions.line_3: Tap the share icon while viewing the page.
instructions.line_4: Tap "options" and choose "Web Archive", tap "save to files", choose a location, and save.
instructions.line_5: Come back to this DataCore page.
instructions.line_6: Tap the "Browse for player data file to upload..." button.
instructions.line_7: Choose the file starting with "{{hint}}..." from where you saved it.

shared.title: Player Profile Shared!
shared.description: Your profile was uploaded successfully! Tap here to view your public profile.

share.share_text: You can post your profile to the DataCore server to utilize personalized features of the discord bot, and let other users see your crew, ships, and items.

nag.title: Share Your Player Profile
nag.nag_panel_share: Follow the instructions below to post your player profile to the DataCore server.

share.title: Post Profile to DataCore
share.header: {{share_profile.share.share_text}}. Once shared, your public profile will be accessible by anyone with this link:

instructions.line_1: Click the link, above, to access data exports for spreadsheets including Take My Chrons and Do Not Airlock.
instructions.line_2: Some pages on DataCore, notably fleet pages and event pages, may also link to your public profile.
instructions.line_3: Information being shared is limited to: {{list}}. No private information is included in your public profile.

share.info_list: DBID, captain name, level, vip level, fleet name and role, achievements, completed missions, your crew, items and ships
share.check_auto_share: Automatically post profile when importing player data

error.error_title: Your profile failed to upload, with the error: {{errorMessage}}
error.error_panel_share: Follow the instructions below to try again.
